prompt:
Describe the spatial relationships in this diagram.

CONTAINMENT: Which text labels are inside or outside each closed curve?
CONNECTIONS: Which text labels are connected by lines? Note any branching or unconnected lines.
BOUNDARY CROSSINGS: Do any lines cross the boundaries of closed curves?
NESTING: Are any closed curves nested inside others?

Do not interpret meaning. Only describe what you see spatially.
evaluation:
# Spatial Description of the Diagram

## CONTAINMENT:
- **Inside the main closed curve (elongated oval/capsule shape):** The text "catholic" and "cadres" appear on the left side, while "woman" appears on the right side
- **Outside all closed curves:** The text "woman" appears to the right of the main shape

## CONNECTIONS:
- There is a line connecting "catholic" and "cadres" to "woman" (the one inside the curve)
- A line extends from "woman" (inside) and crosses the boundary, continuing to "woman" (outside)
- There appears to be a small curved or looped element at the top of the diagram
- The connecting lines show: catholic/cadres → woman (inside) → woman (outside)

## BOUNDARY CROSSINGS:
- Yes, a line crosses from inside the main closed curve to outside
- The line exits through the right side of the main oval shape
- This line connects the internal "woman" label to the external "woman" label

## NESTING:
- There appears to be a smaller closed curve or loop at the top portion of the diagram
- This smaller element sits above or overlaps with the main elongated oval shape
- The main capsule/oval shape is the primary boundary, with this smaller curved element positioned at its upper edge
